WorkItem.ClosedComment: Due to an odd proc from a previous expansion, it's actually working as intended.  Only works in heavy raid situations and is not recommended however, but all the math and numbers are right for heavy raid situations.
WorkItem.Description:
How come Trauma is listed as Best in Slot for restoration shamans? I love to hear the nature of this, somewhat awkward, statement.
Â 
I attached a file to it. There are no filters on it and it's the newest version (on version 4.17, it was also already there)

Comments.Message:
You are *not* using the latest version if you are using 4.0.17 like in the image. The latest is 4.0.19.

Please open your character in .19 , verify the issue is still present and post the character file (and another screen shot if you please).

By the time I have made that printscreen and posted this ticket, I still was using 4.17. I downloaded 4.19 and it's still there.

Hereby a print screen. A character file will be posted in the next reply, as appaerently, you can only add one attachment per post.

Your statement Schadow was incorrect.  You said 'Best in slot for resto shaman?'   
Your chosen spell style is raid, using chain heal and rip tide.  For this specific setup and situation, yes, the proc just ends up winning over a 359 weapon.  However, change your style to anything else and you'll see trauma go poof.  

There are always items from previous expansions that end up still being useful, or better at the new level cap.  It's not a bug that trauma is up there, the proc is indeed that powerful, however it's only useful in a raid healing situation, so keep that in mind if you intend to use it.  If you don't want it there, filter out 277 items.

allright, thank you. I did not made a statement, I just said that Rawr made a statement.

Thank you nevertheless.
